info.title: Planning Center Groups
info.description:
Planning Center Groups can help you create an online group index, take signups,
and track attendance.

tags.name: Person
tags.description:
A person is a user of Planning Center.
They can be a member of a group, a leader of a group, or an administrator.

tags.name: Group
tags.description: A group of people that meet together regularly.

tags.name: GroupApplication
tags.description: A group application is a request to join a group which can be approved or rejected.

tags.name: Campus
tags.description: A campus as defined in Planning Center Accounts

tags.name: Event
tags.description:
An event is a meeting of a group. It has a start and end time, and can be
either physical or virtual.

tags.name: GroupType
tags.description:
A group type is a category of groups.
For example, a church might have group types for "Small Groups" and "Classes".

tags.name: TagGroup
tags.description:
A way to group related tags.
For example you could have a "Life Stage" tag group
with tags like "Child", "Teen", "Adult", etc.

/events/{event_id}/rsvps.description:
A person's RSVP response for a group event.
RSVPs can be submitted at any point leading up to the event.
When an event reminder is sent, `awaiting_response` RSVPs are generated for
any remaining members, or `not_sent` if they're missing an email address.

pagination_per_page_parameter.name: per_page
pagination_per_page_parameter.description: Maximum number of records per page

schedule.description:
A text summary of the group's typical meeting schedule.
Can be a string like "Sundays at 9:30am" or "Every other Tuesday at 7pm".

tag_ids.description:
The IDs of the tags associated with the group.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

schedule.description:
A text summary of the group's typical meeting schedule.
Can be a string like "Sundays at 9:30am" or "Every other Tuesday at 7pm".

tag_ids.description:
The IDs of the tags associated with the group.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

joined_at.description: The date and time the person joined the group.

role.description:
The role of the person in the group.
Possible values: `member` or `leader`

joined_at.description: The date and time the person joined the group.

role.description:
The role of the person in the group.
Possible values: `member` or `leader`

group_type.description:
The group type that this group belongs to.
Unique groups do not belong to a group type
and will return a `null` data set for the relationship.

The group type that this group belongs to.
Unique groups do not belong to a group type
and will return a `null` data set for the relationship.

attendance_attributes.description: Individual event attendance for a person.

attended.description: Whether or not the person attended the event.

role.description:
The role of the person at the time of event.


Possible values: `member`, `leader`, `visitor`, or `applicant`

attendance_attributes.title: Attendance

campus_attributes.description: A campus as defined in Planning Center Accounts
campus_attributes.title: Campus

enrollment_attributes.description: Details on how and when members can join a `Group`.

auto_closed.description: Whether or not enrollment has been closed automatically due to set limits

auto_closed_reason.description: Brief description as to which limit automatically closed enrollment

date_limit.description: Date when enrollment should automatically close

date_limit_reached.description: Whether or not the `date_limit` has been reached

member_limit.description: Total number of members allowed before enrollment should automatically close

member_limit_reached.description: Whether or not the `member_limit` has been reached

status.description:
Current enrollment status. Possible values:
* `open` - strategy is not `closed` and no limits have been reached
* `closed` - strategy is `closed` _or_ limits have been reached
* `full` - member limit has been reached
* `private` - group is unlisted

strategy.description: Sign up strategy. Possible values: `request_to_join`, `open_signup`, or `closed`

enrollment_attributes.title: Enrollment

event_attributes.description:
An event is a meeting of a group. It has a start and end time, and can be
either physical or virtual.

attendance_requests_enabled.description:
This is a group setting that applies to all the events in the group.
If selected, an email will be sent to the primary email address of the group leader
60 minutes before the event start time, asking them to report attendance.

automated_reminder_enabled.description:
If `true`, we send an event remind some specified time before the event starts
to all members in the group.

canceled.description: Whether or not the event has been canceled.

canceled_at.description: The date and time the event was canceled.

description.description: A longform description of the event. Can contain HTML markup.

ends_at.description: The date and time the event ends.

multi_day.description: `true` if the event spans multiple days. Otherwise `false`.

reminders_sent.description: `true` if reminders have been sent for this event. Otherwise `false`.

reminders_sent_at.description: The date and time reminders were sent for this event.

repeating.description: `true` if the event is a repeating event. Otherwise `false`.

starts_at.description: The date and time the event starts.

virtual_location_url.description:
The URL for the virtual location. Typically we don't show this URL unless
unless the location_type_preference is "virtual".

visitors_count.description:
The number of visitors who attended the event. These are people who are not
members of the group.

event_attributes.title: Event

eventnote_attributes.description: Notes that group leaders can write for an event, generally related to attendance.

body.description: The body text of the note.

eventnote_attributes.title: EventNote

group_attributes.description: A group of people that meet together regularly.

archive_status.description:
Used for querying only. Defaults to `not_archived`.


Possible values: `not_archived`, `only`, or `include`

archived_at.description: The date and time the group was archived.

can_create_conversation.description:
A boolean representing the current user's authorization to start a new conversation in the group.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

chat_enabled.description: A boolean representing whether or not the group has Chat enabled.

contact_email.description:
If a contact_email is provided, we will display a contact button on the public page
where potential members can ask questions before joining the group.

created_at.description: The date and time the group was created.

description.description: A longform description of the group. Can contain HTML markup.

events_visibility.description:
The visibility of events for the group.


Possible values: `public` or `members`

header_image.description:
A hash of header image URLs. The keys are `thumbnail`, `medium`, and `original`.

```json
{
  "thumbnail": "https://groups-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/group/header_image/1986065/thumbnail_image-1676676396838.jpg",
  "medium": "https://groups-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/group/header_image/1986065/medium_image-1676676396838.jpg",
  "original": "https://groups-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/group/header_image/1986065/image-1676676396838.jpg"
}
```

leaders_can_search_people_database.description:
Whether or not group leaders have access to the entire
church database on the admin side of Groups. (Not recommended)

location_type_preference.description:
The location type preference for the group.


Possible values: `physical` or `virtual`

members_are_confidential.description: Whether or not group members can see other members' info

memberships_count.description:
The number of members in the group, includes leaders.
Does not include membership requests.

public_church_center_web_url.description: The public URL for the group on Church Center.

schedule.description:
A text summary of the group's typical meeting schedule.
Can be a string like "Sundays at 9:30am" or "Every other Tuesday at 7pm".

tag_ids.description:
The IDs of the tags associated with the group.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

virtual_location_url.description:
The URL for the group's virtual location. A zoom link, for example.
This could be set even if `location_type_preference` is `physical`.
This is useful if you want to display a zoom link even if the group is meeting in person.

widget_status.description:
DEPRECATED: This is a private attribute used by Home widgets that we plan to remove soon.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

group_attributes.title: Group

groupapplication_attributes.description: A group application is a request to join a group which can be approved or rejected.

message.description: An optional personal message from the applicant.

status.description:
The approval status of the application.

Possible values: `pending`, `approved`, or `rejected`

groupapplication_attributes.title: GroupApplication

grouptype_attributes.description:
A group type is a category of groups.
For example, a church might have group types for "Small Groups" and "Classes".

church_center_visible.description: `true` if the group type contains any published groups. Otherwise `false`.

church_center_map_visible.description: `true` if the map view is visible on the public groups list page. Otherwise `false`.

color.description:
Hex color value. Color themes are a visual tool for administrators on the admin side of Groups.
Ex: "#4fd2e3"

default_group_settings.description: A JSON object of default settings for groups of this type.

description.description: A description of the group type

name.description: The name of the group type

position.description: The position of the group type in relation to other group types.

public_church_center_web_url.description: The public URL for the group on Church Center.

grouptype_attributes.title: GroupType

display_preference.description:
This preference controls how the location is displayed to non-members for public groups and events.


Possible values: `hidden`, `approximate`, or `exact`

full_formatted_address.description:
Ex: "1313 Disneyland Dr
Anaheim, CA 92802" (may be approximate or `null`)
Approximate address would be "Anaheim, CA 92802".
We obscure Canadian zip codes.

radius.description:
The number of miles in a location's approximate address.
Will be `0` if the strategy is exact, and will be `null` if the strategy is hidden.

strategy.description:
The display preference strategy used for the current request, based on user permissions.
Either `hidden`, `approximate`, or `exact`.

membership_attributes.description:
The state of a `Person` belonging to a `Group`.

A `Person` can only have one active `Membership` to a `Group` at a time.

joined_at.description: The date and time the person joined the group.

role.description:
The role of the person in the group.
Possible values: `member` or `leader`

membership_attributes.title: Membership

organization_attributes.description: The organization represents a single church. Every other resource is scoped to this record.

time_zone.description: The time zone of the organization.

organization_attributes.title: Organization

owner_attributes.description: The owner/creator of an event note.

avatar_url.description: The URL of the person's avatar.

owner_attributes.title: Owner

person_attributes.description:
A person is a user of Planning Center.
They can be a member of a group, a leader of a group, or an administrator.

addresses.description: Returns all the addresses associated with this person.

avatar_url.description: The URL of the person's avatar.

child.description:
Whether or not the person is under 13 years old.
This is false if a birthdate is not set.


Only available when requested with the `?fields` param

created_at.description: Date and time this person was first created in Planning Center

email_addresses.description:
Returns all the email addresses associated with this person.

```json
[{
  "address": "sam@example.com",
  "location": "Home",
  "primary": true
}]
```

phone_numbers.description:
Returns all the phone numbers associated with this person.

```json
[{
  "number": "(800) 123-4567",
  "carrier": null,
  "location": "Mobile",
  "primary": true
}]
```

person_attributes.title: Person

rsvp_attributes.description:
A person's RSVP response for a group event.
RSVPs can be submitted at any point leading up to the event.
When an event reminder is sent, `awaiting_response` RSVPs are generated for
any remaining members, or `not_sent` if they're missing an email address.
rsvp_attributes.title: RSVP

resource_attributes.description: A file or link resource that can be shared with a group.

description.description: The description of the resource written by the person who created it.

last_updated.description: The date and time the resource was last updated.

resource_attributes.title: Resource

tag_attributes.description:
Tags are used to filter groups.
They can be organized into tag_groups.

position.description: The position of the tag in relation to other tags

tag_attributes.title: Tag

taggroup_attributes.description:
A way to group related tags.
For example you could have a "Life Stage" tag group
with tags like "Child", "Teen", "Adult", etc.

display_publicly.description: Whether or not this tag group is visible to the public on Church Center

multiple_options_enabled.description: Whether or not a group can belong to many tags within this tag group

name.description: The name of the tag group

position.description: The position of the tag group in relation to other tag groups

taggroup_attributes.title: TagGroup

group_type.description:
The group type that this group belongs to.
Unique groups do not belong to a group type
and will return a `null` data set for the relationship.

location.description:
The group's default location is where the group normally meets.
But remember, each group event can have its own location if needed.

created_by.description: The person who created this resource

scopes.groups: Required scope for accessing via OAuth 2

personal_access_token.description:
Provide your Personal Access Token Client ID as the HTTP Basic username
and your Secret as the HTTP Basic password.

Example header:
Authorization: Basic BASE64(client_id:secret)"
